message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.DL. 

The paper proposes a framework for using value-based methods in continuous action spaces, which is a common problem in reinforcement learning. The paper focuses on the Actor-Expert framework, which decouples action-selection from the action-value representation. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and deep learning (cs.DL). Given the focus on reinforcement learning and value-based methods, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. However, the paper also includes a two-timescale analysis, which is more relevant to cs.SY. Finally, the paper proposes a new method for learning the greedy action, which is relevant to deep learning (cs.DL).
